description: Usage in reference to the Chinese comedic performance is probably a loose calque of Chinese 相聲／相声 (xiàngsheng).

entries.meaning: (electronics) Undesirable signals from a neighbouring transmission circuit; undesired coupling between circuits.
(biology) The situation where one or more components of a signal transduction pathway affect another pathway.
Conversation that is incidental to the topic under discussion.
examples: I couldn't hear the opening address because of all the crosstalk around me.

entries.meaning: A traditional Chinese comedic performance in the form of a dialogue.

verbs.description: crosstalk (third-person singular simple present crosstalks, present participle crosstalking, simple past and past participle crosstalked)
